title: TILLING A GARDEN IN VIRGIN GROUND WITH A SUBCOMPACT TRACTOR

tasks.task: Operating a John Deere 1025R with a 48-inch tiller for land preparation.
subtasks: Guidance and operation of a subcompact tractor (20-25 horsepower range).
Attaching and deploying a 48-inch tiller to the back of the tractor.
Performing multiple passes over the ground, alternating direction each time.
Observing and noting the initial breakdown of sod, grass, roots, and rocks.
Recognizing the necessity for repeated passes in the initial year compared to subsequent years.

tasks.task: Preparing new ground using appropriate tiller width.
subtasks: Determining proper tiller width for subcompact tractors (48 inches as ideal for 20-25 horsepower machines).
Showing the effectiveness of tiller width for breaking up new ground.

tasks.task: Demonstrating the process of land preparation for new gardens or food plots.
subtasks: Highlighting the initial setup and machine operation.
Documenting the breakdown of vegetation and ground materials.
Advising on the number of required passes in the first year versus maintenance.
